I'm glad you found the list helpful! Lachlan Milne's Instagram is definitely worth checking out.

Regarding "The Silent Forest," I'm not familiar with the film, but I'd love to learn more about it. The Berlinale is a prestigious festival, and I'm sure the cinematography was indeed stunning. If you have any recommendations or insights about the film, feel free to share!

As for film festivals that focus on cinematography or have a strong cinematography program, here are a few recommendations:

1. Camerimage International Film Festival (Poland): This festival is dedicated entirely to the art of cinematography, featuring screenings, workshops, and masterclasses with renowned cinematographers.
2. EnergaCamerimage Festival (Poland): Similar to Camerimage, this festival celebrates the art of cinematography, with a focus on Polish and international films.
3. ASC Master Class (USA): The American Society of Cinematographers (ASC) hosts an annual Master Class, which offers a series of workshops and seminars on cinematography, featuring industry experts and legends.
4. BSC Expo (UK): The British Society of Cinematographers (BSC) hosts an annual Expo, which showcases the latest cinematography equipment, techniques, and innovations, along with masterclasses and panel discussions.
5. Camerimage US (USA): A spin-off of the Polish Camerimage festival, this event takes place in Los Angeles and features screenings, workshops, and panel discussions focused on cinematography.
6. FOCAL International Awards (UK): While not exclusively a film festival, FOCAL International celebrates the best in cinematography and camera work in film, television, and digital media, with a strong focus on the craft.
7. Manaki Brothers International Cinematographers' Film Festival (North Macedonia): This festival, named after the pioneering Manaki brothers, celebrates the art of cinematography and features a competition for cinematographers, as well as workshops and masterclasses.

These festivals offer a unique opportunity to learn from and engage with cinematographers, industry professionals, and like-minded enthusiasts. Keep an eye on their schedules and programs, as they often feature exciting events and guest speakers.

If you have any more questions or recommendations, feel free to share!
